workExperience.title: Senior Software Engineer
workExperience.description: Turknet is a leading internet service provider in Turkey, offering high-speed broadband, voice and data services to residential and business customers. Turknet operates its own fiber-optic network, covering more than 80% of the population, and delivers innovative solutions such as cloud computing, internet of things and smart home applications. I‚Äôm a senior software engineer at the "‚ÄúNetwork Development"‚Äù group "‚ÄúMediation"‚Äù department of Turknet.
achievements: ‚óè PortAuth is a project that aims to improve the authentication, authorization and accounting (AAA) processes of Turknet users. By using PortAuth enhances the security and reliability of Turknet's network, reducing the risk of unauthorized access and fraud.

‚óè I have been involved in the microservice transformation process of many monolithic applications, converting them into services that follow the microservice and DDD principles. In this process, I have applied the best practices of domain-driven design, such as identifying bounded contexts, defining ubiquitous language, designing aggregates and entities, and implementing domain events. I have also used various tools and frameworks to facilitate the development, deployment, and monitoring of microservices.
techStack: Microservice architecture and Domain Driven Designed monolith services

Vakƒ±fbank is a 2nd largest bank by asset size in Turkey. I'm a software engineer at the ‚ÄúDeposit, Money Transfer & Investment‚Äù group ‚ÄúDeposit‚Äù department of Vakƒ±fbank.

‚óè I developed the currency-protected deposit product project, with a focus on YUVAM. During this project, I created the table structure for this module in relational databases. ‚óè I was responsible for the development of the expropriation project. workExperience.title: Software Engineer
